text:
I had a module that used some mod_ssl functions.  The sever would start up 
without a problem.  However when i went to the portion of my site that the 
module was running on( i went there directly with out going through any other 
pages) to test out my module the server would crash and an error would appear 
in my error_log.  This error message would say that mod-ssl already exists in 
memeroy and give me an error code of 17.  I would remove every refernce to my 
module and the server would still crash.  In the end, I would have to reinstall 
Apache even though the Apache was built have dynamically link libraries
creator: srashmo@sandia.gov
trawick@apache.org
text:
Please cut and paste the actual error messages from the error log.
What does "crash" mean?  Segmentation fault?

If you're using prefork MPM on Linux, you should be able to get a 
coredump and see where a segmentation fault occurs.

The error messsage is
Cannot allocate shared memory:mod_ssl (17)File exists
creator: srashmo@sandia.gov

text:
You just need to go delete the mod_ssl temporary files after the crash, then it  
should work.  No need to reinstall.  Look in the logs directory (that's where 
they're stored by default).
creator: jwoolley@apache.org
